alert.note: Alert for Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 5:03PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT THE CENTRAL CITY OF VIRGINIA BEACH THROUGH 545 PM EDT... At 502 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Virginia Beach, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile vehicles. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Virginia Beach around 510 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Oceana, Rudee Heights, Sigma, Sandbridge Beach, Dam Neck, Oceana NAS, Macons Corner, and Pungo. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for southeastern Virginia.
